text: Some penguins live to be 20 years old.
Penguin lifespan varies by species.
Penguins in zoos often live longer than wild penguins.
Penguin survival rates improve with experience.
Older penguins are often better parents.
Some animals can regenerate entire body parts.
Salamanders can regrow limbs perfectly.
Starfish can regenerate from a single arm.
Planarians can regrow their heads.
Zebrafish can regenerate their hearts.
Axolotls can regrow limbs, organs, and even parts of their brains.
Deer regrow their antlers every year.
Lizards can regenerate their tails.
Humans can regenerate their liver.
Children can regrow fingertips under certain conditions.
Sea cucumbers can expel and regrow their organs.
Spiders can regenerate lost legs.
Crabs can regrow claws.
Flatworms can regenerate from 1/279th of their body.
Some hydra are potentially immortal through regeneration.
Regeneration is controlled by specific genes.
The p21 gene may inhibit regeneration in mammals.
Stem cells are key to regeneration.
Blastema is the regeneration bud that forms after injury.
Regeneration research could help paralyzed patients.
Scientists study salamanders to understand human healing.
Bioelectric signals help direct regeneration.
Nerve signals are necessary for limb regeneration.
Some researchers aim to activate dormant regeneration genes in humans.
3D bioprinting may eventually replace regeneration.
Organ-on-a-chip technology mimics real organs.
Lab-grown organs have been successfully transplanted.
Bladders have been grown and implanted in humans.
Tracheas have been grown from patient cells.
Blood vessels can be grown in the lab.
Skin grafts are routinely grown from patient cells.
Cartilage can be grown and implanted.
Heart patches are being developed from stem cells.
Mini-brains (organoids) are grown for research.
Kidney organoids help study disease.
Liver organoids can test drug toxicity.
Intestinal organoids model gut diseases.
Retinal organoids may help restore vision.
Lung organoids were used to study COVID-19.
Tumor organoids help personalize cancer treatment.
Organoids are grown from stem cells.
Induced pluripotent stem cells can become any cell type.
Yamanaka factors can reprogram adult cells to stem cells.
Shinya Yamanaka won the Nobel Prize for iPSCs.
iPSCs avoid embryo ethical concerns.
Patient-derived stem cells reduce rejection risk.
Stem cell therapy treats some blood diseases.
Bone marrow transplants are stem cell therapy.
CAR-T cells are engineered to fight cancer.
The first CAR-T therapy was approved in 2017.
CAR-T has achieved cancer remission in some patients.
Gene therapy can cure genetic diseases.
Luxturna treats a form of inherited blindness.
Zolgensma treats spinal muscular atrophy.
CRISPR is being tested to treat sickle cell disease.
The first CRISPR therapy was approved in 2023.
Casgevy treats sickle cell and beta thalassemia.
Gene editing could potentially cure HIV.
The Berlin patient was cured of HIV by a transplant.
mRNA vaccines can be rapidly developed.
The COVID-19 vaccines used mRNA technology.
mRNA vaccines teach cells to make proteins.
Lipid nanoparticles deliver mRNA into cells.
mRNA cancer vaccines are in clinical trials.
Personalized cancer vaccines target individual tumors.
Immunotherapy harnesses the immune system against cancer.
Checkpoint inhibitors release brakes on immune cells.
PD-1 inhibitors treat various cancers.
Immunotherapy has revolutionized melanoma treatment.
Some immunotherapy patients achieve long-term remission.
The microbiome affects immunotherapy response.
Fecal transplants can restore gut bacteria.
The gut microbiome has trillions of bacteria.
Gut bacteria produce vitamins and neurotransmitters.
The gut-brain axis connects digestive and mental health.
Probiotics can improve gut health.
Prebiotics feed beneficial gut bacteria.
Antibiotics can disrupt the microbiome.
C. diff infections can be treated with fecal transplants.
The skin microbiome protects against pathogens.
Oral bacteria affect heart health.
The vaginal microbiome protects against infection.
Babies get their first microbes during birth.
Breastfeeding shapes infant microbiome.
The microbiome is established by age 3.
Diet strongly affects gut bacteria composition.
Fiber feeds beneficial gut bacteria.
Fermented foods contain live bacteria.
Artificial sweeteners may alter gut bacteria.
Exercise can improve microbiome diversity.
Stress affects gut bacteria.
Sleep deprivation alters the microbiome.
The microbiome varies between individuals.
Microbiome testing is commercially available.
Microbiome research is a rapidly growing field.
